main event: A civilian in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania reported seeing a single, point of light object in the sky on July 2, 1958 around 2:00 AM.
interesting points: The object was described as a yellowish-white point of light, about the size of the head of a pin held at arm's length.
The object disappeared with flashing lights, moving towards the east.
The observer was a civilian employed as a sales engineer for the Arco Corporation.
The weather conditions were reported as no surface winds, unlimited visibility, no clouds, and hazy near the horizon.
